recipes.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry

ingredients.leftover_vegetables: 2 cups mixed (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, etc.)

instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Sauté minced garlic and grated ginger for 30 seconds.
Add leftover vegetables, stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Pour in soy sauce, cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Add cooked rice or noodles, stir until heated through.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Frittata

ingredients.assorted_leftovers: 1 cup mixed vegetables, meats, and cheese

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Whisk eggs, season with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
Sauté assorted leftovers briefly in the skillet.
Pour beaten eggs over the mixture in the skillet.
Cook on stovetop for 3-4 minutes.
Bake in oven for 12-15 minutes until set.
Let it cool before slicing.

recipes.name: Pasta Primavera
instructions: Cook pasta, drain, and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Sauté minced garlic for 1 minute.
Add assorted leftover vegetables, cook until softened.
Mix in cooked pasta, season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese before serving.

recipes.name: Vegetable Soup
instructions: Heat oil in a pot, add onions, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened.
Add assorted leftover vegetables, broth, herbs, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, simmer for 20-25 minutes.
If adding pasta or rice, include it in the last 10 minutes of cooking.
Season with salt and pepper, remove bay leaves before serving.

recipes.name: Leftover Fried Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic, stir for 30 seconds.
Toss in leftover meats/tofu, cook for a few minutes.
Add frozen peas and carrots, cook until heated through.
Stir in cooked rice, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Mix well.
Cook for a few more minutes until everything is heated evenly.

recipes.name: Taco Salad
instructions: Mix cooked meat with taco seasoning in a bowl.
Assemble salad: layer lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and seasoned meat.
Top with sour cream and crushed tortilla chips.

recipes.name: Pantry Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
Heat olive oil in a pan, add minced garlic, cook for a minute.
Pour in the canned tomatoes, simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Add cooked pasta to the sauce, mix well.
Season with herbs, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.

recipes.name: Quinoa Salad
instructions: Combine cooked quinoa, diced vegetables, and herbs in a large bowl.
Whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper to make dressing.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Top with crumbled feta cheese if desired.

recipes.name: Leftover Roast Sandwich
instructions: Slice or shred the leftover roasted meat.
Toast the bread or rolls if desired.
Spread mustard and mayonnaise on the bread.
Layer the meat, pickles, lettuce, and tomatoes to make the sandwich.

recipes.name: Pantry Veggie Burgers
instructions: Mash the beans/lentils in a bowl.
Add breadcrumbs, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Form the mixture into patties, using flour or egg as a binder if needed.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and cook patties for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown.
Serve on burger buns with your favorite toppings.
